meanings.definition: Speak in a low or barely audible voice, especially in dissatisfaction or irritation.
meanings.sent1: She mutters under her breath when she is upset.
meanings.sent2: He always mutters when he is annoyed.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat mutters to itself while staring out the window.
meanings.sent4: The old house mutters with creaks and groans in the night.
meanings.sent5: The wind outside mutters a haunting tune through the trees.

meanings.definition: Utter words indistinctly or in a low tone.
meanings.sent1: The tired student mutters while trying to read the small print.
meanings.sent2: The shy child mutters when asked to speak in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The broken robot mutters random phrases as it malfunctions.
meanings.sent4: The stream mutters softly as it flows over the smooth stones.
meanings.sent5: The distant thunder mutters warnings of an approaching storm.
